page.title: 11The village of Norton.
page.content: Norton is a small village close to the gentle trout stream _The Poulter.Once on the main coach road between Mansfield and Worksop ,the Village used to boast 5 inns and 10 shops , but in 1900 the 5th Duke of Portland objected to the growing traffic passing so close to his residence and the road was replaced by the present A60 through Cuckney.Now there is only one shop and there has been no public house for over 75 years. The village comprises of old stone properties rented from the Welbeck Estate and a few modern bungalows for older people.There is no church. All residents questioned were very content with life at Norton despite the lack of facilities.Considerable concern and and inconvenience has been caused recently however by damage to property through mining subsidence.
